page.title: 03THE UPLANDS WEST OF PENRYN
page.content: This is a fairly flat rural area (ranging from 150 to 200 metres above sea level). It is predominantly agricultural with dairy cattle and a mixture of crops. There are 2 large granite quarries, one with processing facilities e.g. producing building blocks, and a third only partly in the area plus several disused quarries. There are two small villages, Rame and Longdowns, straddling the one major road (A394 Penryn-Helston) each with basic shopping facilities. Longdowns had a small trading estate of small wholesalers and very light industry. The area also included the outskirts of Mabe including the only school in the area, shortly to be moved to another site. An interesting experi- mental project at the old Rosemanowas quarry involves heating water by pumping it through hot rocks.
